互联网3.0时代，什么才是搭建项目官网的正确姿势？
item.description:
互联网3.0时代，什么才是搭建项目官网的正确姿势？

简介

项目背景

国产的CMS系统已经是古董了，国际的主流CMS意识也并不超前，又难以满足极客对真正效率的追求。

本文，将深度探讨，并尝试一次低耦合的CMS系统建设方案。在每个需求环节，选取最佳的技术实现方案，各模块通过RESTful API进行整合及协同。

示例项目 http://vr.anasit.com

技术总览

  • hugo
  • hugo-themes
    • galactica
    • 演示：http://astritbublaku.com/demos/galactica/
  • markdown
  • yaml
  • RESTful APIs
  • github pages
  • rss
  • google ads

系统架构

静态页面生成模块

  • Themes 主题机制
  • Templates 模板机制
  • Taxonomies 分类机制
  • Contents 内容格式化

信息采集聚合模块 aggregator

  • RSS 采集
  • Twiter 采集

内容筛选解析格式化模块

  • Pocket 筛选解析，先存再读的模式

用户审查发布模块

UGC用户自主写文模块

  • 选择一：支持git的markdown编辑器
  • 选择二：支持api获取文章内容的，在线云笔记

Refer to “A list of CMSs built with Laravel”

from: http://maxoffsky.com/code-blog/list-cmss-built-laravel/

Yesterday Ryan Tablada organized a Google Hangout in which Matt Staffer, me (Maks Surguy), Jake Chapman, and Alex Dover were discussing CMSs built with Laravel and the future of such systems.

You can watch our discussion here and also read the conversation on Google+ (link on the bottom of this post):

Before the discussion, I had compiled a list of CMSs that already exist or are being built with Laravel and you can see that list below:

Stable

Laravel Bootstrap https://github.com/davzie/laravel-bootstrap
TypiCMS https://github.com/sdebacker/TypiCMS
Bootstrap starter site https://github.com/andrewelkins/Laravel-4-Bootstrap-Starter-Site
Pongo CMS v1 (uses Laravel 3) http://pongocms.com – do not use as v2 is being developed
Wardrobe CMS (blogging) https://github.com/wardrobecms/wardrobe
CodeSleeve https://github.com/CodeSleeve/platform

In development at the moment

PongoCMS v2 http://pongocms.com
October CMS http://octobercms.com/
Larapress https://github.com/larapress-cms/larapress
Coanda https://github.com/CoandaCMS/coanda-core
PyroCMS v3 https://www.pyrocms.com/
Platform (Release Candidate) https://cartalyst.com/manual/platform

Watch our discussion on video

You can watch the discussion and read the comments here: https://plus.google.com/events/caepul2187kfpr84gkluar2mirc

What do you think about CMSs and particularly about the future of CMS? Let me know in the comments or on Twitter.
